publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-8194 Jack McConnell: Live Below the Line—That the Parliament welcomes the Live Below the Line campaign launched by the Global Poverty Project in March 2011; notes that supporters of the campaign will live on less than £1 a day between 2 and 6 May; believes that the campaign is an excellent way to highlight the plight of 1.4 billion people who live in extreme poverty, and looks forward to as many people as possible supporting the campaign and the Global Poverty Project’s aim of invigorating a global movement to take effective, concerted action to end extreme poverty in an a generation. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Jackie Baillie*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bill Kidd*, Michael McMahon*, Helen Eadie*, Ken Macintosh*, Elaine Murray*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Irene Oldfather*, Trish Godman*, Elaine Smith*, Patrick Harvie*, Mary Scanlon*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Bill Butler*, Robin Harper*
